alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 10:42PM MST until January 08 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches below 7500 feet and 4 to 6 inches above 7500 feet. Locally higher amounts possible at mountain peaks. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Far Northwest Highlands, Jemez Mountains, Northwest Highlands, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, Chuska Mountains, Northwest Plateau, West Central Mountains, and West Central Plateau. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
